Reserves and Academy|Everton]] |years1 = 2010–2018 |clubs1 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] |caps1 = 150 |goals1 = 21 |years2 = 2012 |clubs2 = → [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] (loan) |caps2 = 13 |goals2 = 4 |years3 = 2013 |clubs3 = → [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] (loan) |caps3 = 4 |goals3 = 0 |years4 = 2018– |clubs4 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] |caps4 = 24 |goals4 = 3 |nationalyears1 = 2008–2009 |nationalteam1 = [[England national under-16 football team|England U16]] |nationalcaps1 = 7 |nationalgoals1 = 2 |nationalyears2 = 2009–2010 |nationalteam2 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] |nationalcaps2 = 7 |nationalgoals2 = 2 |nationalyears3 = 2010–2012 |nationalteam3 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] |nationalcaps3 = 12 |nationalgoals3 = 0 |nationalyears4 = 2013 |nationalteam4 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] |nationalcaps4 = 3 |nationalgoals4 = 0 |nationalyears5 = 2011–2013 |nationalteam5 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] |nationalcaps5 = 5 |nationalgoals5 = 1 |nationalyears6 = 2013– |nationalteam6 = [[England national football team|England]] |nationalcaps6 = 25 |nationalgoals6 = 2 |club-update = 16:08, 3 March 2019 (UTC) |nationalteam-update = 15:00, 11 February 2019 (UTC) }} '''Ross Barkley''' (born 5 December 1993) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as an [[attacking midfielder]] for {{English football updater|Chelsea}} club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] and the [[England national football team|English national team]].
Barkley began his professional career at [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] in 2008. After [[Loan (sports)|loan]] spells at [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] and [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] he became a regular in their team, playing 179 total games and scoring 27 goals for Everton. He signed for Chelsea in January 2018.
Barkley made his full international debut in 2013. He played for England at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] and was selected in [[Roy Hodgson]]'s 23-man squad for [[UEFA Euro 2016]] but did not appear in any of England's matches. Managers and teammates have compared his style of play to those of [[Michael Ballack]], [[Paul Gascoigne]] and [[Wayne Rooney]].
==Early life== Barkley was born in [[Liverpool]], Merseyside.<ref>{{Hugman|22190|accessdate=5 December 2017}}</ref> He joined [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] as an 11-year-old and played for the club's youth teams. He was named as a [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] in a first team league match in early 2010–11, and was expected to make his [[Premier League]] debut<ref>{{cite news |last=Doyle |first=Ian |title=Bank on Barkley to shine at Blues says boss Moyes |url=http://www.dailypost.co.uk/sport-news/everton-fc/2011/04/28/everton-fc-s-ross-barkley-will-break-through-next-season-says-david-moyes-55578-28596667/ |accessdate=8 August 2011 |newspaper=Liverpool Daily Post |date=28 April 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6ABtLpGgM?url=http://www.dailypost.co.uk/sport-news/everton-fc/2011/04/28/everton-fc-s-ross-barkley-will-break-through-next-season-says-david-moyes-55578-28596667/ |archivedate=25 August 2012}}</ref> before his leg was broken in one place after a collision with [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]]'s [[Andre Wisdom]] during an England under-19 match in October 2010.<ref>{{cite news |title=Everton's Ross Barkley breaks leg on England U19 duty |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/e/everton/9092603.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=8 August 2011 |date=14 October 2010}}</ref>
==Club career== ===Everton=== ====Early career==== He recovered from his injury in time to join the first team for pre-season training before the beginning of 2011–12. During pre-season, [[Tim Cahill]] heralded Barkley as the most talented footballer he had worked with.<ref>{{cite web |title=Cahill Speaks To GrandOldTeam |url=http://www.grandoldteam.com/news/general-news/2011/jun/13/cahill-speaks-to-grandoldteam |publisher=GrandOldTeam |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110809065151/http://www.grandoldteam.com/news/general-news/2011/jun/13/cahill-speaks-to-grandoldteam |archivedate=9 August 2011}}</ref> He made his debut in Everton's first home match of the season, a 1–0 defeat to [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]], and was named man of the match by Radio City Sport.<ref>{{cite web |last=Lewis |first=Andy |title=Barkley handed debut |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/archive/2011/08/20/barkley-handed-debut |publisher=Everton F.C |accessdate=20 August 2011 |date=20 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6ABtMGlA5?url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/archive/2011/08/20/barkley-handed-debut |archivedate=25 August 2012}}</ref> His early performances were highly praised, with [[Martin Keown]] predicting that "[Barkley will] be one of the best players we'll ever see in this country."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14739060.stm |title=Transfer deadline quotes of the day |date=31 August 2011 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=31 August 2011}}</ref> He signed a new four-and-a-half-year contract in December 2011.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/16217561.stm |title=Teenager Ross Barkley signs long-term Everton contract |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 December 2011 |accessdate=17 December 2011}}</ref>
On 14 September 2012, Barkley joined [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] on a one-month [[Loan (sports)|loan]],<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19597936 |title=Sheffield Wednesday sign Everton's Ross Barkley on loan |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=14 September 2012}}</ref> making his debut the same day in an away defeat against [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19515143 "Brighton 3–0 Sheff Wed"]. BBC Sport. 14 September 2012. Retrieved 27 October 2012.</ref> He scored his first goal for the club, a penalty, against [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] the following week.<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19614957 "Sheffield Wed 1–2 Bolton"]. BBC Sport. 22 September 2012. Retrieved 22 September 2012.</ref> His loan was extended before he was recalled by Everton after playing 13 matches for Wednesday.<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20030003 "Everton's Ross Barkley extends Sheffield Wednesday loan"]. BBC Sport. 22 October 2012. Retrieved 27 October 2012.</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/archive/2012/11/19/barkley-to-return-to-blues |title=Barkley To Return To Blues |publisher=Everton F.C. |accessdate=19 November 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121122050748/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/archive/2012/11/19/barkley-to-return-to-blues |archivedate=22 November 2012 }}</ref> He again went out on loan, this time to [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] for an "initial one-month stint", in January 2013<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/archive/2013/01/11/barkley-loaned-to-leeds |title=Barkley Loaned To Leeds |date=11 January 2013 |accessdate=11 January 2013 |publisher=Everton F.C. |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Dr7svEYi?url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/archive/2013/01/11/barkley-loaned-to-leeds |archivedate=22 January 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20130111/everton-midfielder-arrives-on-loan_2247585_3038068 |title=Everton midfielder arrives on loan |date=11 January 2013 |accessdate=11 January 2013 |publisher=Leeds United F.C. |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130113061715/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20130111/everton-midfielder-arrives-on-loan_2247585_3038068 |archivedate=13 January 2013}}</ref> and made his debut for Leeds in a derby match against [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20130112/barnsley-live_2247585_3038388 |title=Barnsley vs Leeds |date=12 January 2013 |accessdate=12 January 2013 |publisher=Leeds United F.C. |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131004233514/http://www.leedsunited.com/news/20130112/barnsley-live_2247585_3038388 |archivedate=4 October 2013}}</ref>
====2013–2018==== [[File:DinamoKiev-Everton (8).jpg|thumb|upright|Barkley playing for [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] in 2015]]
Barkley re-joined the Everton first team for the [[2013–14 Everton F.C. season|2013–14 season]]. He scored his first goal for the club on the opening day in a 2–2 draw against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]], and was later named man of the match.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23644749 |title=Norwich 2–2 Everton |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=17 August 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/287291/report |title=Premier League: Everton draw 2–2 with Norwich at Carrow Road |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=18 August 2013}}</ref> During the first half of the season, Barkley put in several man-of-the-match performances, notably against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] and [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] – the latter whom he scored the winner against.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25387089 |title=Swansea 1–2 Everton |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=23 December 2013}}</ref> He received praise from many pundits including [[Alan Hansen]] who said Barkley has absolutely everything and [[Gary Lineker]] who claimed he is a star in the making and a prodigious talent.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25297570 |title=Everton's Ross Barkley can reach the top, says Alan Hansen |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=23 December 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25488606 |title=Ross Barkley: Everton midfielder can star for England says Lineker |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=23 December 2013}}</ref>
Barkley's first FA Cup goal came on 4 January 2014, opening a 4–0 win over Queens Park Rangers in the third round.<ref>{{cite news |last=Reddy |first=Luke |title=Everton 4–0 QPR |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25531987 |accessdate=26 May 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 January 2014}}</ref> In March, Barkley scored a superb solo goal against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] in which he ran from his own half to net the opener in a 3–0 victory.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26404288 |title=Newcastle 0–3 Everton |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=4 June 2014}}</ref> On 18 April 2014, he was named as one of the six players on the shortlist for the [[PFA Young Player of the Year]] award.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/apr/18/pfa-player-of-the-year-award-shortlist-gerrard-lallana| |title=PFA Player of the Year award shortlist: Gerrard and Lallana nominated |date=18 April 2014 |accessdate=19 April 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref> He scored a total of 6 goals in 34 Premier League matches throughout the season, including a goal against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] on 3 May which BBC Sport described as "spectacular" and was awarded goal of the season at Everton's end of year awards.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27168536 |title=Everton 2 Manchester City 3 |date=3 May 2014 |accessdate=3 May 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2622880/Seamus-Coleman-Toffees-player-season-Ross-Barkley-wins-best-goal-Man-City-strike-Everton-awards.html |title=Seamus Coleman is Toffees' player of the season while Ross Barkley wins best goal for Man City strike at Everton awards |newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |accessdate=4 June 2014}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref>
On 29 July 2014, Barkley signed a new contract with Everton, keeping him at the club until 2018.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/archive/2014/07/29/barkley-signs-new-deal |title=Barkley Signs New Deal |date=29 July 2014 |accessdate=29 July 2014 |publisher=Everton F.C.}}</ref> Before the start of the 2014–15 season he suffered an injury to his [[medial collateral ligament]],<ref>{{cite news |title=Roberto Martínez: Ross Barkley may make Everton return in eight weeks |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/aug/19/roberto-martinez-ross-barkley-everton-eight-weeks |date=12 August 2014 |accessdate=31 August 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref> and did not play until 18 October 2014, setting up [[Romelu Lukaku]]'s goal in a 3–0 home league win over [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]]. He scored his first goal of the season in a 3–1 win over Queens Park Rangers on 15 December.<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30373609"Everton 3–1 QPR"]. BBC Sport. 15 December 2014. Retrieved 17 March 2015.</ref>
Barkley started the 2015–16 season with goals in Everton's first two league matches.<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33744642"Everton 2–2 Watford"]. BBC Sport. 8 August 2015. Retrieved 9 August 2015.</ref>
Barkley scored Everton's first goal of the 2016–17 season on the opening day of the season, netting in the fifth minute of a 1–1 home draw against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36994878 |title=Everton 1–1 Tottenham Hotspur |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 August 2016}}</ref> In May 2017, Everton manager [[Ronald Koeman]] issued an ultimatum to Barkley, stating that if he was not signing a new contract, despite being offered an extension by the club, he would be sold in the summer.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/ross-barkley-contract-everton-transfer-news-ronald-koeman-press-conference-a7730236.html |title=Ronald Koeman gives Ross Barkley ultimatum over his Everton future |date=11 May 2017 |newspaper=The Independent |access-date=15 August 2017}}</ref> Koeman said on 26 July that Barkley had told him that he was ready for a new challenge and that he would not be signing a new contract with the club.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.nsno.co.uk/everton-news/2017/07/koeman-barkley-will-not-offered-new-everton-deal/ |title=Koeman: Barkley will not be offered new Everton deal |publisher=nsno.co.uk|access-date=26 July 2017}}</ref>
Barkley did not feature for Everton in his final season with the club, having been sidelined with a long-term hamstring injury.<ref name=ChelseaTransfer/>
===Chelsea=== [[File:BarkleyvSouthampton.jpg|150px|thumb|Barkley playing for [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in 2018]]
On 5 January 2018, Barkley joined Premier League club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] for a fee of £15 million, signing a five-and-a-half-year contract with the defending champions. He was assigned shirt number 8 by the club, the same number he wore at Everton.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2018/01/barkley-joins-the-blue.html |title=Barkley joins the Blues |publisher=Chelsea Football Club |date=5 January 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42574404 |title=Ross Barkley: Chelsea sign midfielder from Everton for £15m |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 January 2018 |accessdate=5 January 2018}}</ref> Barkley had been close to joining Chelsea previously on the summer transfer deadline day, before a move failed to materialise due to him suffering a long-term injury and wanting to consider his options.<ref name=ChelseaTransfer>{{Cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/jan/05/ross-barkley-chelsea-everton |title=Chelsea announce signing of Ross Barkley from Everton in £15m deal |newspaper=The Guardian |date=5 January 2018}}</ref> Days after its completion, the transfer was referred to [[Merseyside Police]] by the [[Mayor of Liverpool]], [[Joe Anderson (politician)|Joe Anderson]], to investigate the possibility of fraud in the transaction.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-merseyside-42626014 |title=Mayor refers Barkley transfer to police |date=10 January 2018 |work=''BBC News''}}</ref> No fraud was found.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ross Barkley transfer: 'No fraud' in Everton to Chelsea move |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-merseyside-42705253 |accessdate=17 January 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 January 2018}}</ref> Barkley made his debut in a 2–1 defeat at Arsenal in the semi-final second leg of the [[EFL Cup]] on 24 January. He came on as a first-half substitute, replacing the injured [[Willian (footballer, born 1988)|Willian]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Report: Arsenal 2 Chelsea 1 (2–1 on agg) |url=https://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2018/01/report--arsenal-v-chelsea1.html |date=24 January 2018 |publisher=Chelsea F.C.}}</ref> Barkley made his Premier League debut in a 3–0 home loss to [[AFC Bournemouth]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Chelsea Suffer Shock 3–0 Defeat to Bournemouth in Premier League Action |url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/2756978-chelsea-suffer-shock-3-0-defeat-to-bournemouth-in-premier-league-action |date=1 February 2018 |publisher=Bleacher Report}}</ref>
On 7 October, Barkley scored his first goal for Chelsea in a 3–0 win away to [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] in the Premier League after a strong start to the season under new manager [[Maurizio Sarri]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Ross Barkley takes chance as Blues pose mount title threat: five things we learned from Chelsea vs Southampton |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/chelsea-southampton-five-things-we-learned-ross-barkley-eden-hazard-a8572981.html |date=8 October 2018 |work=The Independent}} </ref> He followed that up with a last minute equaliser against [[Manchester United]] at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]] on 20 October. Barkley came off the bench to help Chelsea snatch a 2-2 draw.<ref>{{cite news |title=REPORT: CHELSEA 2 MANCHESTER UNITED 2 |url=https://www.chelseafc.com/en/news/2018/10/20/report--- |date=21 October 2018|publisher=Chelsea Football Club}}</ref> On 28 October, he scored for the third game running against [[Burnley FC|Burnley]] at [[Turf Moor]], netting in a 4–0 win.<ref>{{cite news |title=REPORT: BURNLEY 0 CHELSEA 4 |url=https://www.chelseafc.com/en/news/2018/10/28/report--burnley-v-chelsea |date=28 October 2018 |publisher=Chelsea Football Club}}</ref> On 15 February 2019 Barkley scored his first European goal as Chelsea beat Malmö 2-1 in their [[Europa League]] last 32 first leg tie. He scored again in his second successive Europa League game against [[Malmö FF|Malmö]] six days later in the second-leg tie at Stamford Bridge.<ref>{{cite news |title=Malmo 1-2 Chelsea: Ross Barkley scores first European goal in Europa League last-32 first leg |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11959/11637446/malmo-1-2-chelsea-ross-barkley-scores-first-european-goal-in-europa-league-last-32-first-leg |date=15 February 2019 |work=SkySports}} </ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Chelsea 3-0 Malmo (5-1 aggregate): Maurizio Sarri's side ease into Europa League last 16 first leg |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/chelsea-vs-malmo-ff/403952 |date=21 February 2019 |work=SkySports}} </ref>
==International career== [[File:Barkley Ross.jpg|thumb|upright|Barkley playing for [[England national under-19 football team|England under-19s]] in 2012]]
Barkley was eligible to represent both England and Nigeria as he has a Nigerian grandfather. Barkley opted to represent his country of birth.<ref>[http://www.voice-online.co.uk/article/ross-barkley%E2%80%99s-rise-makes-him-world-cup-banker] The Voice. 14 January 2014. Retrieved 13 August 2013.</ref> He has represented England at [[England national under-16 football team|under-16]], [[England national under-17 football team|under-17]], [[England national under-19 football team|under-19]], [[England national under-20 football team|under-20]], [[England national under-21 football team|under-21]] and [[England national football team|senior level]].<ref name="thefa-profile">{{cite web |title=FA.com Profile: Ross Barkley |url=http://www.thefa.com/England/All-Teams/Players/B/Ross-Barkley |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=8 August 2011}}</ref>
He was first called up for the under-16 level in September 2008, aged 14.<ref>{{cite news |last=Johnson |first=Tim |title=Barkley follows Rodwell and Baxter into England side |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=30 September 2008}}</ref> He was selected to play in the 2009 [[Montaigu Tournament]] and [[Captain (association football)|captained]] the team to success, beating [[Germany national youth football team|Germany]] 2–1 on penalties in the final.<ref>{{cite web |title=England retain Montaigu title |url=http://www.thefa.com/England/Mens-u16s/news/2009/england_germany_report_130409 |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=8 August 2011 |date=13 April 2009}}</ref> He also helped England win the [[2010 UEFA European Under-17 Championship]] with two goals en route to the final where England beat [[Spain national under-17 football team|Spain]] 2–1.<ref>{{cite web |title=England comeback seals U17 crown |url=http://www.uefa.com/UNDER17/matches/season=2010/round=15345/match=2002343/index.html |publisher=UEFA |accessdate=8 August 2011 |date=30 May 2010}}</ref>
Barkley was called up to the England U-21 squad in August 2011. On 28 May 2013, he was named in manager [[Peter Taylor (footballer, born 1953)|Peter Taylor]]'s 21-man squad for the [[2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup]].<ref>[http://www.thefa.com/england/mens-u20s/News/2013/u20s-world-cup-squad-announcement-280513 "Final squad named"]. The Football Association. 28 May 2013. Retrieved 17 June 2013.</ref> He made his debut on 16 June, in a 3–0 win in a warm-up match against [[Uruguay national under-20 football team|Uruguay]].<ref>[http://www.thefa.com/england/mens-u20s/News/2013/uruguay-report-160613 "Training win for Three Lions"]. The Football Association. 16 June 2013. Retrieved 17 June 2013.</ref> He scored his first goal for England under-21s on 13 August 2013, in a 6–0 win against [[Scotland national under-21 football team|Scotland]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23690472 "England Under-21s thrash Scotland 6–0 in friendly"]. BBC Sport. 13 August 2013. Retrieved 13 August 2013.</ref>
Barkley was called up to the senior England squad in August 2013,<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23853555 "Andros Townsend and Ross Barkley in England squad"]. BBC Sport. 27 August 2013. Retrieved 27 August 2013.</ref> and earned his first senior cap the following month, coming on as a substitute for [[Jack Wilshere]] in a 4–0 win in a [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification|World Cup qualifier]] against [[Moldova national football team|Moldova]] at [[Wembley Stadium|Wembley]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23921240 "England 4–0 Moldova"]. BBC Sport. 6 September 2013. Retrieved 10 September 2013.</ref> He was named in the [[2014 FIFA World Cup squads|England squad]] for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] in Brazil,<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/may/12/england-world-cup-squad-hodgson-barkley-sterling |title=England World Cup squad 2014: Ross Barkley and Raheem Sterling called up |date=12 May 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=14 May 2014}}</ref> and made his World Cup debut as a 61st-minute substitute for [[Danny Welbeck]] in England's 2–1 opening defeat to [[Italy national football team|Italy]] in [[Manaus]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=McNulty |first1=Phil |title=England 1–2 Italy |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25285071 |accessdate=19 October 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 June 2014}}</ref> He played the full match in England's final group match, a 0–0 draw with [[Costa Rica national football team|Costa Rica]] in [[Belo Horizonte]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25285354 |title=Costa Rica 0–0 England |date=24 June 2014 |accessdate=4 April 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the senior team in a 6–0 win against [[San Marino national football team|San Marino]] in a [[UEFA Euro 2016 qualifying|UEFA Euro 2016 qualifier]] in September 2015.<ref name="San Marino 0–6 England">{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/33273427 |title=San Marino 0–6 England |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 September 2015 |accessdate=7 April 2016}}</ref>
==Style of play== In 2013, Everton manager [[Roberto Martínez]] described Barkley as a mix of [[Paul Gascoigne]] and [[Michael Ballack]].<ref name=ballack>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25294790 |title=Everton boss Roberto Martinez praises Gerard Deulofeu impact |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=23 December 2013}}</ref> England manager [[Roy Hodgson]] has said that Barkley's "pace and power" as well as his "excellent technique" are reminiscent of Paul Gascoigne,<ref name=gascoigne>{{cite web |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11095/9553225/european-qualifiers-roy-hodgson-says-ross-barkley-reminds-him-of-paul-gascoigne |title=European Qualifiers: Roy Hodgson says Everton and England's Ross Barkley reminds him of Paul Gascoigne |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=2 April 2016}}</ref> and [[Frank Lampard]] stated that Barkley reminds him of a young [[Wayne Rooney]].<ref name=rooney>{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/2014/jun/ross-barkley-reminds-frank-lampard-of-a-young-wayne-rooney-060614 |title=Ross Barkley reminds Frank Lampard of a young Wayne Rooney – England |publisher=The Football Association |date=6 June 2014 |accessdate=2 April 2016}}</ref> [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] midfielder [[Xavi]] said in November 2014 that Barkley is good enough to play for the [[La Liga]] club, praising his physical and technical qualities.<ref>{{cite news |title=Liverpool's Raheem Sterling good enough to play for Barcelona, says Xavi |url=http://www.squawka.com/news/emperors-empires-barcelonas-xavi-discusses-the-modern-game/217333 |accessdate=18 November 2014 |publisher=Squawka News |date=11 November 2014}}</ref>
